alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 3:02AM EST until December 11 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County. For the Brandywine Creek...including Downingtown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek below Downingtown. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 7.0 feet and rising. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EST Monday was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.2 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 03/01/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date East Branch Bran Downingtown 7.0 7.0 Mon 2 am 6.8 MSG 7.2 9am 12/11 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM EST.
